alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Dubuque (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 04 at 10:24AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Jo Daviess, Dubuque and eastern Delaware Counties through 1100 AM CDT... At 1023 AM CDT, trained weather spotters reported a strong thunderstorm near Hopkinton, or 12 miles southeast of Manchester, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Dyersville, Farley and New Vienna around 1035 AM CDT. Epworth, Holy Cross, Luxemburg and Bankston around 1040 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Dubuque, Rickardsville, Sherrill, Sageville, Balltown and Durango. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
